title: Icelorn
content:
Icelorn. The clans of Acheron toast their Queen and their Chosen, who are by now ice-locked

within Castle Acheron. Communal howling continues long into the evening.

title: Week of Feast/Fast
content:
Week of Feast/Fast.

Week of Feast/Fast. Devout followers of the Divine Corpse abstain from eating while the

sign of Feast is in the sky. Heretical followers of Feast secretly gorge themselves all week.

title: Burning Moon
content: Visible for 5 nights during the Sign of Perception. This moon glows pellucid and white, so luminous the world is denied full darkness for an entire week.

title: Astrologer’s Vigil
content:
Followers of Perception prepare for a night of star-gazing. On this evening,

the burning glory of the night sky reveals truths not usually discernible to the naked eye.

title: Bautenmoot
content: All bautenlobbe travel to a secret location deep within the Weald. The reason for this meeting is unknown, but their collective effort to attend makes clear its importance.

title: Mass Pontifex - Sanctum Votum
content:
Sanctum Votum. The devout meditate on the sin of Bliss. This Mass Pontifex is the only

day on which nobles can marry. Villagers will have a lot to say about which wedding was best.

title: The Ecclesiarch’s Largesse
content:
The Ecclesiarch’s Largesse. Each officially recognised Guildhall receives a shipment of

goods and supplies from the Ecclesiarch, intended as a thanks for services rendered.

title: Feast of the Wicker King.
content:
Feast of the Wicker King. Followers of Feast construct a fat wicker figure holding a carved

wooden bowl. The bowl is filled with food and the figure burnt.

title: Sign of Rot.
content:
Sign of Rot. At dawn, all unharvested crops wither and rot in their fields. Nothing edible

remains. Villagers across the land hold a harvest festival to celebrate the end of their labours.

title: Day of Murmurs
content: Followers of Justice air their grievances publicly, making their grudges known verbally to those who have wronged them.

title: Fædernich
content:
Fædernicht. Farmers sacrifice an adult male animal to Fecundity, praying for virile livestock

in the next breeding season.

title: Blessing of the Keys
content:
Blessing of the Keys. Members of the clergy go house to house in villages, saying prayers

over any keys found within.

title: Repentance
content:
The Wyccefinders’ Guild empties its dungeons and commences a day of trials.

The day closes with a mass pyre; in Assartum, these can fill entire city squares.

title: Feast of Twelve Families
content:
Feast of Twelve Families. Noble houses lay a table with 12 place settings: 5 are provided with

food and drink, 7 are left empty. Nobles are expected to show generosity toward their lessers

title: The March
content:
The March. Soldiers chosen for winter leave begin the march homewards from Wealdean

fronts. All roads leading to Assartum fill with regiments of happy foot soldiers.

title: The March
content: Soldiers on winter leave return to one of several Wealdean fronts. This begins as a parade through Assartum and descends into the gruelling march it actually is.

title: Thieves’ Banquet
content:
Thieves’ Banquet. Followers of Voracity steal something they do not want or need, only to

hide it somewhere they will forget, dotting the countryside with hidden caches of valuables.

title: Mort-Aux-Rats
content:
Mort-Aux-Rats. A ratcatching holiday. Peasants are given one obol for every rat they kill (as

counted in tails) and present to the Ratcatchers’ Guild.

title: Investiture
content:
New Ecclesiarchs are officially crowned on this day, while reigning Ecclesiarchs

celebrate their official birthday instead. Feasts and banquets are held throughout the land.

title: Singing Grindstones
content:
Singing Grindstones. Members of the Woodcutters’ Guild return to the Weald. They stop

in villages and get their axes sharpened. Blacksmiths do not charge for this service today.

title: Lytlingnicht
content:
Lytlingnicht. Farmers sacrifice a young animal to Fecundity, praying for healthy offspring

in the next breeding season

title: Ossein Moon
content:
Visible for 3 nights during the Sign of Frenzy. This moon glows bone yellow and its rising marks the beginning of opiri feeding frenzies (opiri, p. 259).

Dies primus - Long-dormant opiri nests burst into activity. Entire settlements perish in a jubilant rush of hungry wings. The night is thick with the sound of feeding opiri-gara.

Dies Secundus - Opiri emerge again, returning to devastated towns in search of survivors. Frenzy’s favoured seethe across ruined, hollow places.

Dies tertius - On the final night of the full moon, the hunger of the opiri drives them further afield. They scour forests and villages, searching for fresh meat and marrow

title: Famished Moon
content: Visible for 3 nights during the Sign of Voracity. This moon is noticably smaller than any other, and consequently much darker. Any who eat under its light will find themselves ever-hungry.

title: Deliverance
content:
Assartum’s stocks, pillories and holding cells are emptied; their contents

brought before the Justiciers and declared guilty. The day closes with mass executions.

title: Duellist's Moon
content: Visible for 3 nights during the Signs of Honour and Panic. This moon glows the crimson of fresh-spilt blood. There are many theories about the hole at its centre.

title: Laceworker Egg Hatching
content: On this evening, any unhatched laceworkers spill out of their egg cases. The night crawls with colour.

title: Wende-withers.
content:
Wende-withers. As the sign of Rot gives way to that of Honour, any unharvested wendeworts

begin to shrivel and die. The hollow trees in which they grew begin to disintegrate.

title: New Moon (ROT)
content: As the new moon creeps across the land, bultchlings emerge from putrid crops and plant wendeworts (p. 287) in hollow trees.

title: Death of Joy
content:
On this day the Sublime Joy was torn from the skies and murdered by Templar.

Ever since, it has been darkened by a solar eclipse. A matching eclipse occurs on Dies Quartius.

title: Laceworker Egg Laying
content:
Laceworker Egg Laying. Glutted on the insects attracted by Blighted Moon, the

laceworkers begin laying eggs in earnest. These remain dormant until the following spring.

title: Sanctum Ablutio
content:
On this Mass Pontifex, the devout meditate on the sin of Exultation.

Children who have reached 8 years of age are baptised in running water.

title: Day of Deals.
content:
Day of Deals. Both the Ecclesiastical devout and the heretical followers of Honour regard

deals and promises made on this day to be ‘more binding’ than on any other.

title: Obsequies
content:
Following the week of revelry, the Gravediggers’ Guild inter the deceased. Each

of the dead receives burial rites, an individual grave and a copper key.

title: Day of Wagers
content: It is tradition to make a wager with a friend, to be paid before the dawning of Dies Tertius. Those who do not pay up are called ‘ballycur’ until they do.

title: Mass Pontifex - Sanctum Profundio
content:
Sanctum Profundio. The devout meditate on the sin on Woe. The Ecclesiarch prays with the

living, then descends to the Sepulchre Reverentia’s catacombs and prays with the dead.

title: New Year’s Eve
content:
New Year’s Eve. Throughout the land, all able-bodied villagers enter forests and fields to

seek out clutches of laceworker eggs, to destroy them before they can hatch in spring.

title: The Dancing Eclipse
content:
The Dancing Eclipse. Worshippers of Ecstasy, Joy and Frenzy celebrate by dancing. As little

as a hop, skip or twirl in front of the wrong person can be enough to get burnt as a wycce.

title: Mass Pontifex - Sanctum Ostentatio.
content:
Sanctum Ostentatio. The devout meditate on the sin of Lamentation. Saints and martyrs

are paraded around a settlement’s outer walls, then ceremonially cast out

title: Mother's Moon
content: Visible for 3 nights during the Signs of the Grimme and Chance. This moon glows orange; its caress causes laceworker eggs to begin hatching en masse.

title: Triumph
content:
The entire city of Assartum celebrates the Ecclesiarch’s official birthday, starting

with a grand parade of Templar.

title: Troth-Plight.
content:
Troth-Plight. Royal knights must deliver news of all proposed noble betrothals to the

Ecclesiarch, in person. Betrothal feasts are held in relevant bordercastles.

title: Maker’s Day.
content:
Maker’s Day. Followers of Toil glorify their patron by destroying either their most recent

or their finest mannekin.

title: Hot Obol Day
content:
Local nobles gather on balconies to hurl scalding obols into the crowds gathered

below. They watch with glee as the poor scrabble to pick up these heated metal coins.

title: Day of Blows
content: Unless appeased the day before, followers of Justice can seek retribution for grudges aired on the Day of Murmurs. It is a day of sudden violence and mysterious corpses.

title: Séance of the Sleepless
content:
Séance of the Sleepless. Followers of Languor burn asphodel, synchronising so they can

become one with Languor, the long-dead and each other all at the same time.

title: Offre Men
content:
Offre Men. Fearful devout construct offre men to put in front of their dwellings. Cults of Panic

are so active this week that, sometimes, the only way to save a house is to offer a straw substitute.

title: Day of Appeals
content:
Those who have been murmured against can seek forgiveness from those

they’ve wronged. Alternatively, they can report them to the Church or the wyccefinders.

title: Blighted Moon
content: Visible for 3 nights during the Sign of Toil. This moon glows corpse grey and sheds tiny flakes of luminescent powder, the rot of stars. Insects emerge in droves to consume this substance.

title: Tongueless Truths
content:
Followers of Oblivion write down secrets and hurl them into the sea, in

glass bottles. Monks and scribes earn good money writing secrets for the illiterate.

title: Procession of the Forlorn.
content:
Procession of the Forlorn. Followers of Hope ritualistically blind one of their own, believing

their hope will bring back the sun. Every year, the sight of the blinded is restored at dawn.

title: Modranich
content: Modranicht. Farmers sacrifice an adult female animal to Fecundity, praying for the safe birth of livestock in the next birthing season.

title: Panic’s Night.
content:
Panic’s Night. Panic makes his influence known in the world; crime and heresy abound. All

who are accosted by the authorities say they couldn’t help themselves – Panic made them do it.
